results.title: Just once
results.creator_credit: Anthony Perris and York Television Centre
results.brief_description: Considers the prevention of accidents to the eyes through wearing of safety lenses. Demonstrates the kind of accidents which can happen in industry. Shows the toughness of the lenses.

results.title: Jumpy, the grasshopper
results.brief_description: Jumpy tells a story about a grasshopper and other insects as a basis for language/arts activities, and to enrich the study of insects. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Journey into time
results.brief_description: Presents an animated overview of the earth’s five great geological eras. Depicts one theory of the earth’s origin, its primeval state, transformation from a fiery ball to an inhabitable globe, and the predominant forms of life throughout geological time. Narrated by Gilbert Mack. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Journey back
results.brief_description: Dramatised account of the rehabilitation of a hemiplegic patient. Deals with the cause and extent of paralysis and demonstrates the work of physical, occupational, recreational and speech therapists and their contribution to the recovery of the patient.

results.title: Jonas Mekas: Three friends
results.brief_description: Born in Lithuania in 1922, Jonas Mekas was displaced from his homeland by the Soviet and Nazi invasions of World War II. Arriving in New York in 1949 with his brother, the two took to New York and having bought a camera, started to document their new lives and all that unfurled around them. This work, “Three friends” is divided into two parts, “Zefrido Tonro” and “Happy birthday to John”. “Zefiro Tonrna” includes images of close friend George Maciunas from 1952, then proceeds to the 1970s, displaying Fluxus (an avant-garde art movement) events and performances and picnics with friends, including Yoko Ono, John Lennon and Andy Warhol. Narrated by Mekas (reading from his diary), who laments the physical demise of Maciunas whilst displaying the spiritedness of Mekas’ involvement in New York’s art scene. “Happy birthday to John” On October 9th 1972, half of the music world gathered in Syracuse New York to celebrate the opening of John Lennon/Yoko Ono Fluxus show, designed by George Maciunas. The same day a smaller group gathered in a local hotel room to celebrate John’s birthday. Part two of “Three friends” is a record of this occasion, documenting the camaraderie of Lennon and Ono’s group of friends and associates. Soundtrack consists of singing by John, Yoko, Ringo Starr, Allen Ginsberg and Phil Oaks, among others. Also includes footage of a Lennon/Ono concert at Madison Square Garden (August 30, 1972) and the vigil in Central Park, December 8, 1980, as well as other rare footage.

results.title: Joining solid conductors
results.creator_credit: Visual Aids, US Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Electrical Wiring”.
How to make the following joints: “Western Union”, pigtail, plain tap, wrapped tap (or Britannica), loop tap and fixture joints; how to use a blow-torch; how to flux and solder joints, and insulate them.

results.title: Joe's party
results.creator_credit: Holman Brothers and TVA Group Production
results.brief_description: Joe is having a party with his family, in a hospital bed, having nearly killed himself in an accident at work. Industrial accidents are invariably caused by failing to exercise care or not observing recognised safety precautions. Shows examples in a stone quarry, but the warnings apply to many industries.

results.title: Job interviews for graduate teachers. Part 2 (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Educational Development Unit, Chisholm Institute of Technology
results.brief_description: This video, the second in a series of two, features two complete yet contrasting interviews for analysis and discussion. Points of note are highlighted at the end of each interview. The first interview is held in an atmosphere which is congenial and supportive, the second in conditions that are cool and detached.

results.title: The Queen of Sheba
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Famous women of the past”.
Strange and dramatic pages from the lives of the world’s most famous women. The Queen of Sheba having heard of King Solomon’s wisdom, travels across the desert to Jerusalem to meet him. The journey is one of the greatest overland journeys in history. On her arrival, the King greets her with majestic splendour, cordiality and hospitality. After a six-month stay, the Queen decides to return home. Following a sumptuous banquet in her honour, King Solomon tricks the Queen and satisfies his lust for this woman of great beauty and deep intelligence. The Queen of Sheba returns home and gives birth to a son. King Soloman never sees the Queen again but does finally meet his 16 yeaer old son, who later becomes the King of Abyssinia.
